Package ru.tinkoff.qa.neptune.http.api

Class HttpRequestGetSupplier<T extends HttpRequestGetSupplier<T>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • ru.tinkoff.qa.neptune.core.api.GetStepSupplier<HttpSteps,​ru.tinkoff.qa.neptune.http.api.HowToGetResponse,​HttpRequestGetSupplier<T>>
      • ru.tinkoff.qa.neptune.http.api.HttpRequestGetSupplier<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.function.Supplier<java.util.function.Function<HttpSteps,​ru.tinkoff.qa.neptune.http.api.HowToGetResponse>>, IgnoresThrowable<HttpRequestGetSupplier<T>>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    HttpRequestGetSupplier.DeleteHttpRequestSupplier, HttpRequestGetSupplier.GetHttpRequestSupplier, HttpRequestGetSupplier.MethodHttpRequestSupplier, HttpRequestGetSupplier.PostHttpRequestSupplier, HttpRequestGetSupplier.PutHttpRequestSupplier
    public abstract class HttpRequestGetSupplier<T extends HttpRequestGetSupplier<T>>
extends GetStepSupplier<HttpSteps,​ru.tinkoff.qa.neptune.http.api.HowToGetResponse,​HttpRequestGetSupplier<T>>
    It builds a function that prepare a HttpRequest to get a response further.

    • Method Detail

      • GET

        public static HttpRequestGetSupplier.GetHttpRequestSupplier GET​(java.lang.String uri)
        Makes preparation for the sending GET-request
        Parameters:
        uri - to send a GET-request. It is possible to define the fully qualified URI as well as a relative path when the DefaultHttpDomainToRespondProperty.DEFAULT_HTTP_DOMAIN_TO_RESPOND_PROPERTY is defined
        Returns:
        a new instance of HttpRequestGetSupplier

        Parameters:
        uri - to send a POST-request. It is possible to define the fully qualified URI as well as a relative path when the DefaultHttpDomainToRespondProperty.DEFAULT_HTTP_DOMAIN_TO_RESPOND_PROPERTY is defined
        publisher - body publisher of the request
        Returns:
        a new instance of HttpRequestGetSupplier

      • methodRequest

        public static HttpRequestGetSupplier.MethodHttpRequestSupplier methodRequest​(java.lang.String uri,
                                                                             java.lang.String method,
                                                                             java.net.http.HttpRequest.BodyPublisher publisher)
        Makes preparation for the sending a request. It sets the request method and request body to the given values.
        Parameters:
        uri - to send a request. It is possible to define the fully qualified URI as well as a relative path when the DefaultHttpDomainToRespondProperty.DEFAULT_HTTP_DOMAIN_TO_RESPOND_PROPERTY is defined
        method - a method to send
        publisher - body publisher of the request
        Returns:
        a new instance of HttpRequestGetSupplier

      • methodRequest

        public static HttpRequestGetSupplier.MethodHttpRequestSupplier methodRequest​(java.lang.String uri,
                                                                             java.lang.String method)
        Makes preparation for the sending a request. It sets the request method to the given value.
        Parameters:
        uri - to send a request. It is possible to define the fully qualified URI as well as a relative path when the DefaultHttpDomainToRespondProperty.DEFAULT_HTTP_DOMAIN_TO_RESPOND_PROPERTY is defined
        method - a method to send
        Returns:
        a new instance of HttpRequestGetSupplier

      • header

        public T header​(java.lang.String name,
                java.lang.String value)
        Adds the given name value pair to the set of headers for this request. The given value is added to the list of values for that name.
        Parameters:
        name - the header name
        value - the header value
        Returns:
        self-reference

      • headers

        public T headers​(java.lang.String... headers)
        Adds the given name value pairs to the set of headers for this request. The supplied String instances must alternate as header names and header values. To add several values to the same name then the same name must be supplied with each new value.
        Parameters:
        headers - the list of name value pairs
        Returns:
        self-reference

      • setHeader

        public T setHeader​(java.lang.String name,
                   java.lang.String value)
        Sets the given name value pair to the set of headers for this request. This overwrites any previously set values for name.
        Parameters:
        name - the header name
        value - the header value
        Returns:
        self-reference

      • timeout

        public T timeout​(java.time.Duration duration)
        Sets a timeout for this request. If the response is not received within the specified timeout then an HttpTimeoutException is thrown when request is performed.
        Parameters:
        duration - the timeout duration
        Returns:
        self-reference

      • version

        public T version​(java.net.http.HttpClient.Version version)
        Sets the preferred HttpClient.Version for this request.
        Parameters:
        version - the HTTP protocol version requested
        Returns:
        self-reference

      • expectContinue

        public T expectContinue​(boolean enable)
        Requests the server to acknowledge the request before sending the body. This is disabled by default. If enabled, the server is requested to send an error response or a 100 Continue response before the client sends the request body. This means the request publisher for the request will not be invoked until this interim response is received.
        Parameters:
        enable - true if Expect continue to be sent
        Returns:
        self-reference

      • useHttpClient

        public T useHttpClient​(java.net.http.HttpClient.Builder clientToBeUsed)
        This method defines a new client to be used until another request built by HttpRequestGetSupplier is sent. This request supplier should be configured by invocation of useHttpClient(HttpClient.Builder) or useDefaultHttpClient(). Also it is possible to invoke HttpSteps.changeCurrentHttpClientSettings(HttpClient.Builder) or HttpSteps.resetHttpClient() for same purposes.
        Parameters:
        clientToBeUsed - is a builder of HttpClient that is going to be used further.
        Returns:
        self-reference

      • useDefaultHttpClient

        public T useDefaultHttpClient()
        This method says that default http client is used further. This client is described by properties. Default http client is used until another request built by HttpRequestGetSupplier is sent. This request supplier should be configured by invocation of useHttpClient(HttpClient.Builder) or useDefaultHttpClient(). Also it is possible to invoke HttpSteps.changeCurrentHttpClientSettings(HttpClient.Builder) or HttpSteps.resetHttpClient() for same purposes.
        Returns:
        self-reference

      • addCookies

        public T addCookies​(java.lang.String uri,
                    java.util.List<java.lang.String> responseHeaders)
        Adds all the applicable cookies, examples are response header fields that are named Set-Cookie2, present in the response headers into a cookie cache.
        Parameters:
        uri - a URI where the cookies come from
        responseHeaders - a list of field values representing response header fields returned
        Returns:
        self-reference

      • addCookies

        public T addCookies​(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.util.List<java.lang.String>> cookieMap)
        Adds all the applicable cookies, examples are response header fields that are named Set-Cookie2, present in the response headers into a cookie cache.
        Parameters:
        cookieMap - is a map of cached cookies. Key is a URI where the cookies come from. Value is a list of field values representing response header fields returned
        Returns:
        self-reference

        public T setCookies​(java.lang.String uri,
                    java.util.List<java.lang.String> responseHeaders)
        Sets all the applicable cookies, examples are response header fields that are named Set-Cookie2, present in the response headers into a cookie cache.
        Parameters:

        responseHeaders - a list of field values representing response header fields returned

        self-reference
